verses.text: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, Thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; Thou that dwellest \add between\add* the cherubims, shine forth.
Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh Stir up thy strength, And come and save us.
Turn us again, O God, And cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
O \sc Lord\sc* God \add of\add* hosts, How long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; And givest them tears to drink \add in great\add* measure.
Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: And our enemies laugh among themselves.
Turn us again, O God \add of\add* hosts, And cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: Thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
Thou preparedst \add room\add* before it, And didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.
The hills were covered \add with\add* the shadow of it, And the boughs thereof \add were like\add* the goodly cedars.
She sent out her boughs unto the sea, And her branches unto the river.
Why hast thou \add then\add* broken down her hedges, So that all they which pass by the way do pluck her?
The boar out of the wood doth waste it, And the wild beast of the field doth devour it.
Return, we beseech thee, O God \add of\add* hosts: Look down from heaven, and behold, And visit this vine;
And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted, And the branch \add that\add* thou madest strong for thyself.
\add It is\add* burnt with fire, \add it is\add* cut down: They perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, Upon the son of man \add whom\add* thou madest strong for thyself.
So will not we go \add back\add* from thee: Quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.
Turn us again, O \sc Lord\sc* God \add of\add* hosts, Cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
